subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove and today I'd
like to ask you a simple question: Are
you taking adequate care of yourself?
By that I mean physically. I'm talking
about your physical body, now. The
reason I bring it up is because it has
been my experience that people, like
myself, who get involved in, you could say,
“head-tripping”, but I would rather call it
the deep exploration of consciousness.
People sometimes who get deeply involved
in psychic work in particular often
don't take adequate care of themselves.
In fact there's even, I think a little
bit of a stereotype of the typical
psychic who is a chubby lady wearing a
muumuu. But that aside, I know it's an
issue not just for people involved in
psychic work but in the whole Western
world. We are suffering from an epidemic
of obesity and in the United States I
think it's the worst of all. So, it's a
question of paying attention to diet and
exercise. It would seem simple enough and
I can tell you that in my own life it's
been a big focus. I started running when
I was in my mid-twenties and have run
several marathons. I’ve practiced yoga.
I've been involved in many different mind-body
disciplines ranging from Aikido to Tai
Chi. It's always been an important
part of my life. In fact, I've talked
about hiking, for example, and how as a hiker with
some of my buddies - in an earlier “In
Presence” segment - I talked about how we
discovered the very first dinosaur
tracks uncovered in the state of Nevada.
Now, the truth of the matter is I haven't
always been so good at it. In fact, lately
it's been a real issue for me. It all
started in September when I was
traveling in Europe and my knee went out
on me. As I’ve mentioned, I'm in my early seventies
now, so it's not uncommon. It was x-rayed
and basically the cartilage is all gone.
So, all of a sudden, hiking is not what it
used to be. I kind of hobble and that's
been going on for six months.
Then shortly after we returned from that
Italy trip, we made the decision to
move to Albuquerque. So, instead of doing
my regular hiking exercise, I kept busy
by packing boxes. Moving can be an
enormous physical effort, packing and
unpacking and lifting and carrying.
That went on for several months and
then we arrived here in Albuquerque and
it was winter and not really all that
pleasant for hiking or riding my bicycle.
It took until springtime for me to
get back on the bicycle and by that time
I realized I had gone for a long time
without regular exercise and I could
feel it in my body. It wasn't the same. So
I have to ask you now: are you getting
enough exercise?
Are you watching your diet? Those are
simple things and I don't have any
particular formula. You're not required
to do some specific kind of yoga
disciplines or something as far as I'm
concerned, but you need to take care of
yourself. That may mean getting more
exercise than you’re getting. It may
mean watching your diet, paying attention
to how much you eat and are you eating
the right kinds of foods for your body?
If you're not, you know what? You know
it. It's so easy to kind of put it
off in the back of your mind. I know
for myself, what happened while I wasn't
exercising is I started doing these daily
video monologues. So, I was compensating
for it and I thought, “Wow I'm getting so
much more work done. Who needs exercise,
anyway?” But the truth is we all do. I
would say, minimum of 20 minutes a day,
that shouldn't be too hard. Even for
people who are disabled, there are things
that you can do sitting in a chair, if
need be. There are all kinds of things
that you could be doing. You know, it
was just a few days ago in the “In
Presence” segment, I talked about your body
as a psychic antenna, as an organ of
psychic reception. But to the extent that
your body is not being cared for, well,
then your psychic sensitivities are
also going to be affected in the same
way. So, if you're a person who is
interested in cultivating your psi
capacities - and I suspect many viewers
are, or at least interested in learning
more about it - taking good care of
yourself is one of the things you need
to do. Because I haven't always taken
the best care of myself, I know it's an
issue for many, many people. It's not an
issue for my wife or my stepson
who I live with
here in Albuquerque, they're both going
off to exercise classes many times a
week and there are so many classes
available these days, it's amazing. I
remember when I was younger, you
didn't see yoga studios, you didn't see
exercise classes on so many street
corners, they didn’t exist. But there is
more consciousness about taking care of
the body now, it's just a question of
doing it. Also I want to just say
this while I have the opportunity in the
monologue, today: I got a delightful
surprise today.
You see, I am thinking of getting knee
surgery
for this knee of mine that's gone out.
I'm really looking at a knee replacement
right now because I'd like to get back
and hike the way I used to. Here in
New Mexico,
there's just wonderful mountains and
hiking, but I am riding my bicycle, but I
haven't started hiking seriously yet.
I've kind of hobbled on some trails but
that's not good enough for me. So, I'm
looking at getting a knee replacement
and today I got a call from the office
of the orthopedic surgeon saying, “We’ve
got to change your appointment. And,
incidentally, are you the Jeffrey
Mishlove who hosts the New Thinking
Allowed channel? Because Michelle, who works
there in the orthopedic department of
the Presbyterian Hospital here in
Albuquerque is a regular viewer.” I
was so delighted to learn that. And so
Michelle, here's to you: thank you for
watching and thank you for reaching out
to me. There's something else I'd like to
add in here, too, about the body. What can
we learn about people who really work
hard to exercise and take care of their
bodies? It's very interesting because, by
and large, we live in a culture that does
focus on the body. If you have athletic
talent or promise, you'll get a lot of
encouragement as a youngster, as opposed
to the kind of encouragement you'll get
if you have psychic talent, which your
parents may find frightening or
embarrassing. We don't encourage young
people to develop their psychic
capacities the way we encourage kids who
have athletic talent, for example. I
expect that that will change. The day
will come when young people who have
parapsychological abilities will be
encouraged and those abilities will be
cultivated just the way we do for people
who are good at basketball, or baseball,
or football, or track, or other sports. Now,
one of the things that we have learned
from people who pursue those areas
is that there seems to be no outer limit
to what is possible. Do you know that new
records are being broken every year in
track and field? We don't know how fast a
human being can run. I was a child when
the four- minute mile which seemed like
an impossible record, was broken. But now
runners are going well, well under
four- minute miles. It just seems as if
records get broken
year after year in almost every event,
because people train harder and train
better. I would think that if we
could take that intensity of focus and
apply it in the parapsychological domain,
we would see progress similarly. We don't
have that yet, but I'm hopeful someday we
will. For those of you who are
watching this video, obviously the
message for you is to check. Check in
with yourself and see if you are doing
everything that you could to live the
healthiest lifestyle that you can.
I'll leave you with that thought today.
Thank you for being with me.
